attributes.action: immediately declare if the postage costs of sending his thousands of letters asking people to vote for him, as recently reported, was borne by the taxpayer and if it was, immediately refund the public purse.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown writing to people to ask for their votes is not expenditure 'wholly and necessarily made in pursuance of his job'.  This is blatant party politics because his 'job' is prime minister and NOT leader of the labour party.  Use of taxpayer pounds to pay for postage costs when sending out party political material is theft and must not be allowed.
